createKafkaRecords(KafkaKcopOperationInIF, KafkaKcopReplicationCoordinatorIF) - Method in interface com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.kafka.KafkaCustomOperationProcessorIF
This method returns zero or more new Kafka records in response to an event on the source database described by the kafkaKcopOperationIn parameter.

By default the method calls createProducerRecords and then converts the resulting ProducerRecord 's to Kafka records.
createProducerRecords(KafkaKcopOperationInIF, KafkaKcopReplicationCoordinatorIF) - Method in interface com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.kafka.KafkaCustomOperationProcessorIF
This method returns zero or more new Kafka ProducerRecord 's in response to an event on the source database described by the kafkaKcopOperationIn parameter.

This method can be called by multiple threads concurrently and thus events are potentially processed in a differing order than they occurred on the source database.
createProducerRecords(KafkaKcopOperationInIF, KafkaKcopReplicationCoordinatorIF) - Method in class com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.sample.kafka.KcopDefaultBehaviorIntegrated
createProducerRecords is called once per subscribed operation that occurs on the CDC Source.
